duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist the Store Manager in overseeing the Station Store operations, including hiring, supervising, and working with staff to accomplish daily tasks, bookkeeping, and merchandising.
Maintain high standards and provide fast and friendly service to customers, ensuring customer satisfaction and resolving issues professionally.
Execute the food program to set high standards and provide exceptional customer care, displaying urgency, patience, and leadership.
Lead a team of employees, recruit, interview, and hire staff, and delegate tasks while providing training and motivating others.
Plan, organize, and communicate operational plans and ideas, as well as handle cash-handling, bookkeeping, and problem-solving.
Complete administrative tasks, such as daily banking, bookkeeping, shift sales analysis, preparation of periodic reports, and achieving sales controls within company policies.
Oversee staffing activities, schedule employees, mentor, and provide feedback to improve performance, ensuring adherence to non-discriminatory related management skills.
Maintain a safe environment for employees and customers, protect company assets, and report any unsafe, unlawful, or unethical conduct to the Store Manager.

Perform physical duties, including occasional work in a walk-in cooler and/or freezer, lifting and carrying up to 60 pounds, reaching overhead for objects, and standing and/or walking for an entire shift.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalent plus 6 months to 1 year of retail and management work experience preferred.
